title: What's In That Shell?
description: What do all shells have in common? They are all hard! But each shell can come in different shapes, sizes, and colors. In What's in That Shell? students will learn about different types of shells and what can be found inside of them. The high-frequency words and repetitive sentence structure can be used to teach students how to compare and contrast as well as to recognize adjectives. Students will also have the opportunity to practice visualizing as they read.
meta: armor, hermit crab, oyster, pearl, swirled, tortoise
